name: 知識與課程專題研究
description: 什麼知識最有價值？知識是如何產生的？學校應傳遞、教導什麼樣的知識？學校課程知識內容的選擇與分配應該如何決定？由誰決定？學校課程呈現了誰的知識？反映了誰的利益？怎樣的課程組織才是合理適切的知識佈局？如何傳遞、溝通、建構值得學習的知識？等問題，不僅僅是課程意識型態問題，更反映出課程知識假設的問題。本課程主要從哲學、心理學及社會學觀點來探討知識與課程的關係，以瞭解課程知識背後複雜的權力、文化及政治角力因素，透過對知識本質的反思以及相關文獻的分析與討論，本課程企圖解析認識論假設、認知途徑與學習、知識選擇等對學校課程的影響，並且進一步探討全球化、數位化時代學校課程知識的挑戰與回應。
goals: 能從教育哲學、認知心理學、教育社會學觀點解析知識與課程的關係
能掌握學校課程知識背後的知識論假設、認知途徑及知識選擇議題
能探討當前全球化、數位化發展趨勢對學校課程知識的影響
能與同儕合作探討課程知識議題，並綜合分析與批判相關文獻，提出個人的見解
syllabus:
1.第一週

  Course Introduction/ Defining “Knowledge”

2.第二週、第三週

  The Nature of Knowledge/What Knowledge Is of Most Worth?

Schrag, F. (1992). Conceptions of knowledge. In P. W. Jackson (Ed.).Handbook of research on curriculum. (pp. 268-301). NY: Macmillan.

Hamm, C. (1989). Educational curricula and the nature of knowledge. In C. Hamm Philosophical issues in education. (pp.59-75). NY: The Falmer Press.

Hirst, P. H. (1974). Knowledge and the curriculum. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. (Chapt.4, 6)

(Brady, M. (1989). What’s worth teaching? Selecting, organizing, and integrating knowledge. New York: SUNY Press.)

3.第四週、第五週

  Philosophical Perspectives on Knowledge and Curriculum

Reid, L. A. (1962). Philosophy and educational assumptions. In L. A. Reid Philosophy and education. (pp.17-40). London: Heinemann.

Brent, A. (1978). Philosophical foundations for the curriculum. London: George Allen & Unwin. (Chapt. 3).

Soltis, J. F. (1981). Education and the concept of knowledge. In F. F. Soltis (Ed.). Philosophy and education. Eightieth yearbook of the NSSE. Chicago: Univ. of Chicago Press.

Ornstein, A. C. (1995). Philosophy as a basis for curriculum decision. In A. C. Ornstein & L. S. Behar (Eds.). Contemporary issues in curriculum. (pp. 10-17). Boston: Allyn and Bacon.

4.第六週

  Exercise: Epistemological/Ideological Assumptions and the Curriculum

Eisner, E. W. (1985). Five basic orientations to the curriculum. In E. W. Eisner The educational imagination. (pp. 61-86).NY: Macmillan.

Eisner, E. W. (1992). Curriculum ideologies. In P. W. Jackson (Ed.), Handbook of research on curriculum (pp. 302-326). New York: Macmillan.

(Eisner, E. W. & Vallance E. (1974). Conflicting conceptions of curriculum. Berkeley, CA: McCutchan.)

5.第七週、第八週

  Psychological Perspectives on Knowledge and Curriculum

Eisner, E. (Ed.). (1985). Learning and teaching the ways of knowing. Righty-fourth yearbook of the NSSE. Chicago: Univ. of Chicago Press. (Chapt.2-7)

Gagne, R. M. (1972). Domains of learning. Interchange, 3(1), 1972.

Biggs, J. B. (1992). Modes of learning, forms of knowing, and ways of schooling. In Demetriou, A., Shayer, M. & Efklides, A. (Eds.). Neo-Piagetian theories of cognitive development: Implications and applications for education. London: Routledge.

Gardner, H. (1999). The Disciplined Mind. New York: Penguin Books. (Chapter 9)

6.第九週、第十週

  Exercise: Ways of Knowing/Learning and the Curriculum

Vallance, E. (1985). Ways of knowing and curricular conceptions: Implications for program planning. In E. Eisner (Ed.). Learning and teaching the ways of knowing. Eighty-fourth yearbook of the NSSE. Chicago: Univ. of Chicago Press.

7.第十一週、第十二週

  Sociological Perspectives on Knowledge and Curriculum

Bernstein, B. (1971). On the classification and framing of educational knowledge. In M. F. D. Young (Ed.). Knowledge and control: New directions for the sociology of education. (pp.47-69). London: Collier-Macmillan.

Beyer, L. E. (1988). Knowledge, ideology, and inquiry. In L. E. Beyer Knowing and acting: Inquiry, ideology and educational studies. NY: The Falmer Press.

Bernstein, B. (2006). Thoughts on the trivium and quadrivium: The divorce of knowledge from the knower. In H. Lauder, P. Brown, J. Dillabough & A. H. Halsey (Eds.), Education, globalization & social change (pp. 119-123). Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Moore, R. (2004). The problems of knowledge. In Education and society: Issues and explanations in the sociology of education (pp. 147-175). Cambridge: Polity Press.

(Apple, M. W. (1993). Official knowledge: Democratic education in a conservative age. NY: Routledge.)

8.第十三週

  Exercise: Knowledge Selection and the Curriculum

Banks, J. (1993). The Canon Debate, Knowledge Construction, and Multicultural Education. Educational Researcher, 22(5), pp. 4-14.

Apple, M. W. (1998). The Culture and Commerce of the Textbook. In L. E. Beyer & M. W. Apple (Eds.). The curriculum: Problems, politics, and possibilities (2nd ed.). (pp. 157-176). NY: SUNY Press.

Noffke, S. E. (1998). Multicultural Curricula: “Whose Knowledge?” and Beyond. In L. E. Beyer & M. W. Apple (Eds.). The curriculum: Problems, politics, and possibilities (2nd ed.). (pp. 101-116). NY: SUNY Press.

9.第十四週

  Power, Culture, and the Politics of Knowledge

Smith, L. T. (2006). Colonizing Knowledge. In H. Lauder, P. Brown, J. Dillabough & A. H. Halsey (Eds.), Education, globalization & social change (pp. 358-369). Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Brown, P. & Lauder, H. (2006). Globalization, Knowledge and the Myth of the Magnet Economy. In H. Lauder, P. Brown, J. Dillabough & A. H. Halsey (Eds.), Education, globalization & social change (pp. 317-340). Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Popkewitz, T. S. (2000). Globalization/reginalization, knowledge, and the educational practices: Some notes on comparative strategies of educational research. In T. S. Popkewitz (Ed.). Educational knowledge: Changing relationships between the State, civil society, and the educational community. New York: SUNY Press.

10.第十五週

  Knowledge and Curriculum Construction

King, Jr. A. R. & Brownell, J. A. (1966). The curriculum and the disciplines of knowledge: A theory of curriculum practice. NY: Wiley. (Chapt. 2,3,4,6)

Phillips, D. C. (1974). Perspectives on structure of knowledge and the curriculum. In P. W. Musgrave (Ed.). Contemporary studies in the curriculum. (pp. 15-29). London: Angus & Robertson. 

Kelly, A. V. (1986). Knowledge and curriculum planning. London: Harper & Row. ( chapt.1,4)

Guile, D. (2006). What is distinctive about the knowledge economy? Implications for education. In H. Lauder, P. Brown, J. Dillabough & A. H. Halsey (Eds.), Education, globalization & social change (pp. 355-366). Oxford: Oxford University Press.

McFarlane, A. (2006). ICT and the curriculum canon: Responding to and exploring ‘alternative knowledge’. In A. Moore (Ed.).Schooling, society and curriculum (pp. 130-141). London: Routledge.

11.第十六週、第十七週

  Report on Rationale for Ideal School Curriculum Design

12.第十八週

  Turn in Final Project Report
